Indian Penal Code (IPC)
This primary criminal code of India covers various offenses and their corresponding punishments. Here, relevant sections are: * Murder: Defined as the unlawful killing of another human being with malice aforethought. * Culpable homicide: Killing of another person without lawful justification or excuse and without the intention to cause death. * Causing hurt: Intentionally or recklessly causing hurt to another person.

Law:
The Indian Penal Code (IPC), 1860 (Section 441): Whoever enters into or upon property in the possession of another with intent to commit an offence or to intimidate, insult or annoy any person in possession of such property, 
or having lawfully entered into or upon such property, unlawfully remains there with intent thereby to intimidate, insult or annoy any such person, or with intent to commit an offence, 
is said to commit “criminal trespass”.
